summary:
- Reiterates human rights monitors' deployment importance in Darfur.
- Requests the Secretary-General to keep it informed and make recommendations.
- Decides to remain seized of the matter.
The Government of the Republic of the Sudan and the Sudan People's Liberation Movement/Army (the Parties) reaffirmed their agreement on six texts, including the Machakos Protocol, Power Sharing, Wealth Sharing, Security Arrangements, and resolution of conflicts in Southern Kordofan/Nuba Mountains, Blue Nile, and Abyei Area. The Parties recommitted to finalizing and concluding the Comprehensive Peace Agreement, recognizing the importance of prompt completion of the Peace Process for the people of Sudan. They acknowledged progress on Security Arrangements and Ceasefire Details and declared that the conclusion of the IGAD-led initiative is central to a comprehensive Peace Agreement, including the resolution of the conflict in Darfur. The Parties affirmed that the six Protocols constitute the core Peace Agreement and invited the UN Security Council to endorse them. They committed to expediting negotiations on two annexes on Ceasefire Agreement and Implementation Modalities to conclude and sign the Comprehensive Peace Agreement by 31st December 2004.
1574 (2004)
